ygData.subject: Re: Farming and stuff
ygData.msgSnippet: Please read my other post, I know THIS is an old post but I feel that RUDE camping is unacceptable, and no there is no where else for some of us to go. I like
ygData.messageBody:
Please read my other post, I know THIS is an old post but I feel that RUDE
camping is unacceptable, and no there is no where else for some of us to go.
I like playing with my American friends, but we never seem to get anything
done, then again when I am playing during US weekdays its GREAT, stuff is
empty, then again finding even a PARTNER can be difficult. Im a warrior and
we all know that at my level if I dont have a partner I may as well logout.
Catch 22.

Fortunately I have real-life friends to fall back on, but that means
restarting my character or playing two characters. Either way its a pain.
Oh well, back to level 1 for me.

> ----------
> From: Morix@...[SMTP:Morix@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 6:21 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Farming and stuff
>
> From: Morix@...
>
> Someone else said:
> >I hate it when people get twinked out like you. Its people like you that
>
> cause the camping >problem. Your guildmates camped for their items, which
> I
> don't have a problem with, the >continued FARMING to get items for
> guildmates, blah. I've never had a single magic item >given to me, I've
> been
> there beside my guild buds working to get my items the whole >game......ok
> I
> shut up now
>
> Yeah, and I bet you also had to walk to school barefoot in the snow uphill
>
> both ways, right? Look, regarding this whole "twinking" thing (a name I'd
>
> not heard before I read this list), I think the ones complaining are the
> ones
> who don't really understand the spirit of the game. They are the ones who
>
> don't realize forming parties and guilds is encouraged, and that while
> remaining solo might be fun sometimes, it just plain won't be as effective
> as
> being part of a group. So then we have these soloists running about
> whining
> about "farmers". My response to that is thus: big fat hairy deal.
> Norrath
> is huge and up 24 hrs. a day. Go find some uninhabited area and start
> your
> own farm. I have zero sympathy for someone whining about how he can't get
> a
> tomahawk axe. Go and kill-steal one. If they were farming (and being
> rude
> about it to boot), then they deserve to have a few kills stolen anyway.
>
